text:
“Make sure to answer truthfully,” Raskolnikov said. 

“But the workmen couldn’t have been there two days before,” Razumihin replied.

Raskolnikov laughed. “Clever people get caught in simple traps.”

Razumihin frowned. “So, he’s a knave?”

Raskolnikov hesitated, feeling strange. “I’m getting a taste for this,” he thought.

Unease washed over him. They stood at Bakaleyev’s entrance.

“Go in alone,” he said abruptly. “I’ll be back.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on the cunning nature of deception and the ease with which intelligent individuals can be ensnared by simple details.
